intro: Dictamnus albus var. kansuensis, commonly known as the Kansu Dictamnus, is a flowering plant native to parts of China. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic, fragrant foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a strong, spicy scent when crushed. This variety is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance and unique fragrance.
